alert.note: Alert for Mercer (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 8:28PM CDT until April 14 at 9:50PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for Spring Creek at Zap affecting Mercer County in North Dakota. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Spring Creek at Zap. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Right bank overflows-west end of Zap begins to flood. Crop land and county roads flood along creek as well. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 15.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.2 feet late tonight. It will then begin falling and is expected to drop below flood stage Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.1 feet on 06/14/1962. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
